# HW1 - Section 7.3


First Open the kernel config with vim :

```
vim ./config-4.2.0-16-generic
```

Then to sort the part of the text first type "v".

Now Select the lines you want using mouse scroll.

then type :

```
:sort
```
Now done, and Here is the output of the lines sorted :


```
#
#
# Automatically generated file; DO NOT EDIT.
# Linux/x86_64 4.2.0-16-generic Kernel Configuration
CONFIG_64BIT=y
CONFIG_ARCH_DEFCONFIG="arch/x86/configs/x86_64_defconfig"
CONFIG_ARCH_HAS_CACHE_LINE_SIZE=y
CONFIG_ARCH_HAS_CPU_RELAX=y
CONFIG_ARCH_HIBERNATION_POSSIBLE=y
CONFIG_ARCH_HWEIGHT_CFLAGS="-fcall-saved-rdi -fcall-saved-rsi -fcall-saved-rdx -fcall-saved-rcx -fcall-saved-r8 -fcall-saved-r9 -fcall-saved-r10 -fcall-saved-r11"
CONFIG_ARCH_MAY_HAVE_PC_FDC=y
CONFIG_ARCH_SUPPORTS_DEBUG_PAGEALLOC=y
CONFIG_ARCH_SUPPORTS_OPTIMIZED_INLINING=y
CONFIG_ARCH_SUPPORTS_UPROBES=y
CONFIG_ARCH_SUSPEND_POSSIBLE=y
CONFIG_ARCH_WANT_GENERAL_HUGETLB=y
CONFIG_ARCH_WANT_HUGE_PMD_SHARE=y
CONFIG_AUDIT_ARCH=y
CONFIG_BUILDTIME_EXTABLE_SORT=y
CONFIG_DEFCONFIG_LIST="/lib/modules/$UNAME_RELEASE/.config"
CONFIG_FIX_EARLYCON_MEM=y
CONFIG_GENERIC_BUG=y
CONFIG_GENERIC_BUG_RELATIVE_POINTERS=y
CONFIG_GENERIC_CALIBRATE_DELAY=y
CONFIG_GENERIC_HWEIGHT=y
CONFIG_GENERIC_ISA_DMA=y
CONFIG_HAVE_INTEL_TXT=y
CONFIG_HAVE_LATENCYTOP_SUPPORT=y
CONFIG_HAVE_SETUP_PER_CPU_AREA=y
CONFIG_INSTRUCTION_DECODER=y
CONFIG_IRQ_WORK=y
CONFIG_LOCKDEP_SUPPORT=y
CONFIG_MMU=y
CONFIG_NEED_DMA_MAP_STATE=y
CONFIG_NEED_PER_CPU_EMBED_FIRST_CHUNK=y
CONFIG_NEED_PER_CPU_PAGE_FIRST_CHUNK=y
CONFIG_NEED_SG_DMA_LENGTH=y
CONFIG_OUTPUT_FORMAT="elf64-x86-64"
CONFIG_PERF_EVENTS_INTEL_UNCORE=y
CONFIG_PGTABLE_LEVELS=4
CONFIG_RWSEM_XCHGADD_ALGORITHM=y

```
